alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:04AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Somerset and Accomack Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 903 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lawsonia, or 19 miles southwest of Pocomoke City, moving southeast at 35 to 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, frequent lightning and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onancock, Parksley, Tangier, Onley, Lawsonia, Marion Station, Tylerton, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis, Wachapreague, Hallwood, Mappsville, Wallops Island, Temperanceville, Nelsonia, Shelltown, Sanford and Modest Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
